Package controller

Class ModifyCustomerController

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyCustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyCustomerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is an FXML Controller class which provides functionality to the Modify Customer screen (the Modify Customer FXML file).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    backButton
    Brings the user back to the Customers Table screen (if the user clicks the button) without saving any of the user input (from the Modify Customer screen).
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    countryLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the combo box used to select the customer's country of residence.
    private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Countries>
    custCountryComboBox
    A combo box (drop-down menu) used to select the customer's country of residence.
    private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<FirstLevelDivisions>
    custDivisionComboBox
    A combo box (drop-down menu) used to select the customer's division of residence (the first-level division of the customer's country in which the customer resides).
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    custIdTextField
    This is the text field that displays the ID of the customer that is currently being modified; however, the user cannot modify the contents of this text field, as customer IDs are auto-generated (by the database) and should not be modified by the user.
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    custNameTextField
    This is the text field where the user can input a new name for the customer (if they wish to modify the name of the customer currently being modified).
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    custPhoneNumberTextField
    This is the text field where the user can input a new phone number for the customer (if they wish to modify the phone number of the customer currently being modified).
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    custPostalCodeTextField
    This is the text field where the user can input a new postal code for the customer (if they wish to modify the postal code of the customer currently being modified).
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField
    custStreetAddressTextField
    This is the text field where the user can input a new street address for the customer (if they wish to modify the street address of the customer currently being modified).
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    divisionLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the combo box used to select the customer's division of residence (the first-level division of the customer's country in which the customer resides).
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    fullNameLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the customer name text field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    identificationNumberLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the customer ID text field.
    private boolean
    localLanguageIsFrench
    Denotes whether the local language is French or a different language.
    (package private) DataHolder
    methodsLibrary
    An instantiation of the DataHolder class; this is necessary in order to call the methods that allow the application to switch to a different scene, as those methods cannot be static (and thus, an instance of the class is required in order to call those methods).
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    modifyCustomerLabel
    This is the header of the Modify Customer page - it reads "MODIFY CUSTOMER".
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    phoneNumberLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the customer phone number field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    postalCodeLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the customer postal code field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    signOutButton
    Brings the user back to the Login Screen (if the user clicks the button) without saving any of the user input (from the Modify Customer screen).
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    streetAddressLabel
    This is the header text that precedes the customer street address field.
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    updateButton
    The button that updates the database record of the customer that is currently being modified (by replacing the old details of the customer record with the new user input); this button also brings the user back to the Customers Table screen.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
    Initializes the controller class.
    private void
    onActionDisplayCustomersTable(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Back" button on the Modify Customer screen is clicked by the user; first, a confirmation dialog box is output to the user (asking the user if they are sure they want to leave the "Modify Customer" screen without saving their input); if they click "OK", this method switches the visible screen back to the "Customers Table" screen.
    (package private) void
    onActionDisplayDivisionsOfSelectedCountry(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method is called when the user selects a country from the country combo box; it populates the division combo box with the first-level divisions of that selected country.
    private void
    onActionDisplayLoginScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Sign out" button on the Modify Customer screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box asking the user if they are sure they want to sign out, and if the user confirms, then this method switches the visible screen to be the Login Screen once again (without saving any of the user input from the Modify Customer screen).
    private void
    onActionUpdateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method is called when the user clicks the "Update" button at the bottom of the Modify Customer screen; it replaces the old contents of the customer record that the user was modifying with the new user-input details (which may or may not have been modified by the user).
    void
    setInputFieldsToContentOfSelectedCustomer(Customers selectedCustomer)
    This method sets all of the input fields (text fields, combo boxes, etc.) on the Modify Customer screen to reflect the values of the customer record that the user selected in the Customers TableView (while they were still on the Customers Table screen, prior to clicking the "Modify" button on that same screen).
    private void
    translateScreenToFrench()
    This method is called if the user's local language is determined to be French; it translates all components on the Modify Customer screen to French.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • localLanguageIsFrench

      private boolean localLanguageIsFrench
      Denotes whether the local language is French or a different language. If this variable is true, the application gets translated to French; otherwise (if this variable is false), the application remains in English.

    • methodsLibrary

      DataHolder methodsLibrary
      An instantiation of the DataHolder class; this is necessary in order to call the methods that allow the application to switch to a different scene, as those methods cannot be static (and thus, an instance of the class is required in order to call those methods).

  • Constructor Details

    • ModifyCustomerController

      public ModifyCustomerController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class. This method links an Observable List to the country combo box. The objects in this Observable List are what will be displayed in the combo box. Additionally, this method determines the ZoneId, Locale, and local language (based on the retrieved Locale) of the current user; using this information, this method decides whether or not to translate the Modify Customer screen to French.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setInputFieldsToContentOfSelectedCustomer

      public void setInputFieldsToContentOfSelectedCustomer(Customers selectedCustomer)
      This method sets all of the input fields (text fields, combo boxes, etc.) on the Modify Customer screen to reflect the values of the customer record that the user selected in the Customers TableView (while they were still on the Customers Table screen, prior to clicking the "Modify" button on that same screen). Thus, this method is called from the Customers Table Controller, where the customer record (a.k.a. Customers object) that the user selected is retrieved and then fed into this function as the parameter.
      Parameters:
      selectedCustomer - The customer (a.k.a. Customers object) that the user selected in the Customers TableView (on the Customers Table screen) prior to clicking the "Modify" button (also on the Customers Table screen). (That "Modify" button is what brought the user onto the current screen [the Modify Customer screen]).

    • translateScreenToFrench

      private void translateScreenToFrench()
      This method is called if the user's local language is determined to be French; it translates all components on the Modify Customer screen to French.

    • onActionDisplayDivisionsOfSelectedCountry

      void onActionDisplayDivisionsOfSelectedCountry(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when the user selects a country from the country combo box; it populates the division combo box with the first-level divisions of that selected country.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, a selection was made in the country combo box.

    • onActionUpdateCustomer

      private void onActionUpdateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method is called when the user clicks the "Update" button at the bottom of the Modify Customer screen; it replaces the old contents of the customer record that the user was modifying with the new user-input details (which may or may not have been modified by the user). Additionally, this method also brings the user back to the Customers Table screen. However, before updating the customer record with the new user input, this method checks to make sure that all user input is valid; if it is not, a descriptive error dialog box is output to the user that prompts them to edit that input (and also gives them pointers on what would be considered valid input). NOTE: The only input field that is allowed to remain empty is the "Phone Number" field; that way, if a customer does not have a phone number, they can still be added to the database. (For purposes of contacting the customer, their home address should suffice).
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Update" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (which is used in the process of switching screens); the exception is only thrown if an error occurs while loading the desired scene.

    • onActionDisplayCustomersTable

      private void onActionDisplayCustomersTable(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Back" button on the Modify Customer screen is clicked by the user; first, a confirmation dialog box is output to the user (asking the user if they are sure they want to leave the "Modify Customer" screen without saving their input); if they click "OK", this method switches the visible screen back to the "Customers Table" screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Back" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (which is used in the process of switching screens); the exception is only thrown if an error occurs while loading the desired scene.

    • onActionDisplayLoginScreen

      private void onActionDisplayLoginScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Sign out" button on the Modify Customer screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box asking the user if they are sure they want to sign out, and if the user confirms, then this method switches the visible screen to be the Login Screen once again (without saving any of the user input from the Modify Customer screen).
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Sign out" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (which is used in the process of switching screens); the exception is only thrown if an error occurs while loading the desired scene.
